title: Can bicarbonate ions be further hydrolyzed? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, why not….? We got HCO−3HCO3−, i.e. O=C(−OH)−O−O=C(−OH)−O− Would not the addition of a further equiv of BASE give carbonate dianion, and water…? O=C(−OH)−O−+−OH⟶CO2−3+H2O(l)O=C(−OH)−O−+−OH⟶CO32−+H2O(l) …charge, and mass are balanced as required…what is the Lewis-dot structure of carbonate dianion…?
